oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Clarksville-Montgomery County 1966 - Industrial Development Commission Report
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report created by Ralph C. Bass for the Clarksville-Montgomery County Industrial Development Commission. The report identifies twelve areas of importance to industries looking to come to a new community: size, available employees, politics and taxes, transportation, utilities, housing, education facilities, religious institutions, recreational and cultural facilities, civic facilities, medical facilities, and shopping and safety infrastructure. The report examines each of these areas in Clarksville-Montgomery County and compares the findings to the perceived desires of new industry.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: City promotion; Place marketing; Economic development; Clarksville (Tenn.); Montgomery County (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bass, Ralph C.
